timeline.bodyText: Might want to rename to SynapseFunctionName
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: Is not a date-time
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: Might be LONG?
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: This can be hard-coded to CURRENT_USER(), unless you need it somewhere else. Might it be that this is a HasFunctionReturnType? (e.g. like the MySqlFunction). How is the return type used? Is it used if the function is in the select clause? E.g. "select current_user() from ..." would need some sort of way to identify the type returned by the select.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: You might not want to make this parameter optional, and always include the id of the user in the constructor of the SqlQueryBuilder.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: This substitution should go in the SqlTranslatorUtils.translateModel method and should not use the replace from the string but rather the utilities in the Model to build the value of the function.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: Unused, can be removed
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: -> CurrentUserFunctionTest
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: Debug messages can be removed
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: You can add an end to end test in the IT100TableControllerTest.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: Most likely, since this can be used in the select you will have to implement the HasFunctionReturnType interface.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.message: UserFunction implement HasReturnType, now can be identified in SELECT clause
Took away optional constructor for userId
Added SQLTranslatorUtilsTest for UserFunction, removed debug messages

timeline.bodyText: you might want to add an assertEquals(1, queryResults.getRows().size()) to check the number of rows and additionally you could check also the number of values: assertEquals(1, queryResults.getRows().get(0).getValues().size()) assuming that your query is something on the lines of "select userId from..."
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: You could extract this into its own method, for example replaceSynapseFunctions
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: Please add a comment that the chain of UnsignedLiteral(unisgnedNumericLiteral... etc is needed for the binding of variables.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: You can directly compare the two maps in the assertEquals without having to compare the entryset
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: You might want to add a test for the getSelectColumns with the currentUser call to check the function return type.
timeline.author: marcomarasca

replies.bodyText: I will also add a FunctionReturnType check to to SQLTranslatorUtilsTest

timeline.bodyText: I think you can use the new SqlQuery userId variable (you can add a getter to the SqlQuery class) without having to pass it down the chain
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.bodyText: You can use the originalQuery.getUserId() (once you add the getter), definetly not 1L :)
timeline.author: marcomarasca

timeline.author: marcomarasca
